--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Shane Mingins" <shane.mingins@...> wrote:
> =
I share this concern and I am trying to ascertain whether it is marketed
> =
this way or if it is a misunderstanding on the part of those being
marketed=

> to. My feeling is that it is the *later* ....

Hi Shane,

Very perceptiv=
e of you.  People seem to hear what they want to hear.
I know, I am one of =
them.

I gave a bunch of presentations/demos where I explicitely said (many=

times over): "Agitator does not generate tests - you don't get a
single te=
st point (i.e. a test assertion) without your participation
and effort.  Ag=
itator *helps* *you* to generate tests".

If you were to ask attendees 2 mi=
nutes after my presentation/demo to
describe Agitator most of the would say=
: "It's a test generator".

I am sure we also share some of the fault since=
 in marketing something
as different as Agitator you need to make reference=
 to something
familiar (i.e. "... it's a bit like an automated test generat=
ors ...")
to help people understand.  And on top of that marketing messages=
 have
to be short and concise.

Alberto
